Safety and security are major concerns of the Paralympic Games organizers since the safety and well-being of the participants and spectators are crucial. The following are some of the common initiatives taken by the Paralympic Games organizers to ensure safety and security:

1. Venue Security: The Paralympic Games usually set up comprehensive security measures at the competition and non-competition venues, including x-ray screening, bag checks, and metal detectors. In addition, they maintain a visible security presence, including security personnel as well as police officers.

2. Crowd Control and Management: The Paralympic Games organizers usually have a plan for crowd control and management to prevent overcrowding, stampedes, and other potential safety hazards. The plan includes designated areas for people to stand and walk, proper signage, and trained personnel to manage the flow of people.

3. Emergency Services: The Paralympic Games organizers usually create an emergency response plan that includes medical services, ambulances, and evacuation plans. They also ensure that the medical services are equipped to deal with different types of disabilities.

4. Cybersecurity Measures: The Paralympic Games organizers implement cybersecurity measures to protect the participants and spectators from online threats. These measures include data encryption, two-factor authentication, network security, and anti-virus software.

5. Transportation Security: The Paralympic Games organizers usually coordinate with transportation providers to ensure the safety and security of the athletes during their travels to and from the venues. This includes secure and accessible transportation services.

6. Background Screening and Accreditation: The Paralympic Games organizers generally perform background screening on all personnel involved in the Games, including volunteers, contractors, and vendors. They also issue accreditations to all personnel requiring access to the venues.

Overall, the Paralympic Games organizers take extensive safety and security measures to ensure the safety and well-being of the participants and spectators, contributing to the success of the Games.
